image.altText: An electronic billboard about 'The Very Hungry Wall'.

props.synopsis: A concrete wall built on the picturesque waterfront of a small Tasmanian town has prompted confusion and concern from residents.

title.children: A Tasmanian council built a wall. It hasn't gone down well

image.altText: Alison McNeice used government concessions to be able to buy her first home 2026-01-08 11:01:00

props.synopsis: Making use of a number of first homebuyer schemes in Tasmania gave Alison "freedom" from the rental market. But, a number of those schemes are due to expire in a few months.

title.children: Tasmania's first homebuyer concessions aid prospective buyers, but for how long?

image.altText: A photo of two smiling men with the sea behind them

props.synopsis: The "swift action" of members of the public has been praised in the rescue of a 74-year-old man who became separated from his boat.

title.children: Two boaties pulled a man from the sea. He only ever said four words.

image.altText: A firefighter hosing the ground

props.synopsis: A total fire ban has been put in place for parts of Tasmania, from Saturday, due to extreme fire weather predicted for this weekend.

title.children: 'Extreme' threat triggers total fire ban in parts of Tasmania

image.altText: A older man in a black cap and checkered shirt smiles

props.synopsis: A 66-year-old Tasmanian man who died after an alleged altercation in Hobart's CBD on Tuesday night has been remembered by those who knew him.

title.children: 'Gentle soul' remembered by friends, family after alleged assault in Hobart

image.altText: An older woman in a green jumper sitting in a park.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian woman who was forced to give up her newborn daughter in 1969 says decisions about a planned redress scheme, which appear to have been made ahead of consultation, have made her feel worthless.

title.children: Forced adoption survivor says Tas compensation figure 'totally inadequate'

image.altText: People stand in the street as cars burn in front of them

props.synopsis: Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has remained defiant amid nationwide protests, saying his regime would not back down in the "face of saboteurs."

title.children: Iran's leader accuses protesters of trying to 'please' Trump

image.altText: A composite image showing the grok logo with overlayed with comments from X.

props.synopsis: For more than a week, X's AI bot Grok has been generating sexual images of women and children at the request of other users, even when they ask it not to.

title.children: Elon Musk limits X's AI image generator over non-consensual sexual imagery

image.altText: Buildings on a hillside behind the silhouette of a person walking.

props.synopsis: The ABC hears from residents of Venezuela's capital, Caracas, about the struggles of daily life and their hopes and fears after American intervention.

title.children: 'Rich have become poor': Venezuelans describe their daily struggle

image.altText: Donald Trump seen from the side gesturing at a podium

props.synopsis: Protecting women and children, halting climate change and preventing acts of terrorism — these are the goals the White House now says go against America's goals.

title.children: Donald Trump withdraws the US from 66 international organisations

image.altText: A Menorah moved to Bondi Beach by Waverley Council.

props.synopsis: After growing calls for a royal commission into the Bondi terror attack, the prime minister has finally announced it would take place, saying it "was what Australia needs".

title.children: The Bondi royal commission is due to report in April. Here's what we know

image.altText: A large grey turtle with sand on its back moves through the sand near multicoloured plastics.

props.synopsis: A beach on a remote island, and home to nesting turtles, is annually overwhelmed by tonnes of plastic garbage. Christmas Island is doing what it can to help stem the never-ending tide of pollution.

title.children: Greta Beach should be pristine. Instead, it's choking on a tsunami of plastic waste

image.altText: A close-up photo of a woman's face

props.synopsis: Palestinian author Randa Abdel-Fattah has called for her appearance at Adelaide Writers' Week to be reinstated after it was axed, but SA's Premier has continued to back the decision, as dozens of authors cancel their appearances.

title.children: Palestinian author calls for apology as dozens quit Adelaide Writers' Week

image.altText: A fan waving a flag that says 'Barmy Army', surrounded by other England cricket fans at a game.

props.synopsis: The Barmy Army has continued the recent trend of UK travellers spending more time and money in Australia, despite a disappointing on-field performance from their side.

title.children: Barmy Army turns Ashes defeat into Australian tourism win

image.altText: A mound of rubbish stretches into the mountainside with a portion slipped down and crushing buildings

props.synopsis: Rescuers managed to recover 13 people from the site overnight as efforts continue to try and find others trapped under the mountain of rubbish.

title.children: Philippines landfill collapse kills at least one person with dozens missing

image.altText: A man and woman dance while performing on a stage surrounded by confetti.

props.synopsis: China has restricted access to South Korean pop culture since 2016, when Seoul received US anti-missile technology. Warmer bilateral ties are spurring optimism that will change.

title.children: Hopes Beijing may lift soft ban on South Korea pop culture as ties thaw

image.altText: People in high-vis work with a ladder near an emergency truck and a metal-walled building.

props.synopsis: Experts say volunteering is not in decline, but it is becoming more spontaneous. The NSW disaster agency is moving to embrace this after seven women mobilised 1,200 people to volunteer for a day in record-breaking floods.

title.children: NSW SES to allow people to volunteer for a day when disaster strikes

image.altText: A baby wombat lies in a blanket in a person's arms.

props.synopsis: There are about 40-50 active volunteer carers within ACT Wildlife, but the organisation says more are needed, especially as the temperature soars.

title.children: 'Terrible job having to cuddle baby wombats': Behind the scenes as a wildlife carer

image.altText: A still from The Sopranos showing a group of dark-haired men looking menacing while standing in front of a delicatessen.

props.synopsis: Restaurant owners in New York would eventually complain of "the Soprano effect" when they lost trade on Sunday nights as patrons headed home to watch the show.

title.children: How the Sopranos transformed TV as we know it

image.altText: Alex de Minaur touches his shirt on his left shoulder at the United Cup.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur produces a signature tenacious display, but it is not enough to send Australia through to the United Cup semifinals in Sydney.

title.children: Aussies exit United Cup and Poland advances to semis

image.altText: Aryna Sabalenka plays a backhand at the Brisbane International.

props.synopsis: Aryna Sabalenka says she is no longer thinking about last year's Australian Open final loss to Madison Keys after defeating the US star at the Brisbane International.

title.children: Sabalenka defeats Keys in Australian Open final re-match

image.altText: People singing and dancing at the Parkes Elvis Festival.

props.synopsis: Japanese tribute artist Toki Toyokazu is part of a growing international presence at the annual Parkes Elvis Festival, which also includes women.

title.children: English is Toki's second language, but he sings in a classic Elvis drawl

image.altText: A residential building is seen damaged in Kyiv, with blown out windows and damaged front walls.

props.synopsis: A "massive" Russian night-time attack on Ukraine damaged 20 residential buildings in Kyiv and its suburbs, as well as Qatar's embassy, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says.

title.children: Russia hits Ukraine with hypersonic missile, Qatari embassy damaged

image.altText: A man, face unseen, wears a camouflage uniform with the US Customs and Border Protection insignia on the sleeve.

props.synopsis: US Border Patrol agents were conducting a vehicle stop in Portland when the driver "weaponised" the vehicle before an officer "fired a defensive shot", according to the Department of Homeland Security.

title.children: US border agent shoots and wounds two people in Portland, Oregon, police say

image.altText: Protesters gather in front of the US consulate during a demonstration in Nuuk

props.synopsis: The United States has a long history of wanting to acquire Greenland, but people living on the island say Donald Trump's latest comments about annexation feel different.

title.children: In Greenland, Trump's talk of annexation is stirring up a dark past

image.altText: A screengrab of a video showing a man being led off a plane with his head covered by a bag.

props.synopsis: Accused scam boss Chen Zhi is extradited to China from Cambodia after being indicted by the United States over an alleged multi-billion-dollar fraud.

title.children: Alleged cybercrime 'mastermind' goes from billionaire to black bag over the head

image.altText: A spotty-skinned bluey-grey shark with a milky eyeball that's got a white copepod hanging off it.

props.synopsis: The Greenland shark is thought to live for about 400 years but somehow its eyes appear to barely deteriorate, according to a new study that has implications for human health.

title.children: Greenland shark eyes may hold anti-aging secrets

image.altText: Chris Minns in suit with Yasmin Catley behind. Both are outdoors with trees

props.synopsis: Premier Chris Minns did not dispute a report that 200 people attended a fundraiser dinner, but could not recall how an event of that size raised only about $6,000.

title.children: NSW premier responds to undeclared donation allegations

image.altText: A crowd pulses through the city

props.synopsis: Australia's population is forecast to reach 28 million people in 2026 despite an easing of overseas arrivals following the post-COVID-19 migration peak.

title.children: Australia's population forecast to reach 28 million this year

props.synopsis: The industrial hub is playing a key role in the AI industry as it pumps out a critical material needed to cool high-performance computer chips.

title.children: The Queensland town taking heat out of the global AI industry

image.altText: caravans in a row

props.synopsis: Administrators of the collapsed luxury caravan manufacturer have threatened to sue David Biggar, whose company owes customers millions of dollars.

title.children: Zone RV director faces litigation over $21 million insolvent trading claim

image.altText: Teagan Croft with long hair, blonde highlights wearing a suit jacket

props.synopsis: Australian actress Teagan Croft will take on the lead role of Rapunzel in Disney's Tangled. The 21-year-old will star alongside Milo Manheim in the live-action remake.

title.children: Who is Teagan Croft, the Australian actor cast as Rapunzel in Disney's Tangled?

image.altText: A man resting his chin on his hand

props.synopsis: Four of the most senior public servants working on South Australia's algal bloom have rejected allegations that departmental staff had been instructed not to investigate the cause of the ecological disaster until after March's state election.

title.children: 'Absolutely no direction' to stop algal bloom investigations, public service chiefs say

image.altText: The back of a young boy's head, looking toward a teacher at the front of a classroom.

props.synopsis: The data, tabled in Queensland Parliament, showed there were 20,833 occupational violence and aggression incidents reported by school-based employees last year.

title.children: Violence against Qld state school staff nearly quadruples in three years

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in a suit

props.synopsis: The prime minister's critics feel he failed to meet the moment in the immediate aftermath of the Bondi attack, but with the royal commission he has a chance to get it right.

title.children: Calling a royal commission is just the start of Albanese's leadership test
